lines.text: Behind that big hedge over there, there's a little man who was Santa Claus to the whole world - Edmund Gwenn.
I've been a salesman too long not to recognize sales resistance when I see it.
I can't figure out my feelings towards you, I despise you, and I pity you. I don't even want to shake your hand, and yet I almost wish you luck.

How can a man call a woman his wife for eight years - someone who you love, who loves you - how can you call her and tell her that you must have a divorce? Worse than that, you've been unfaithful - you're going to be a father. How can you hurt someone so much?
For the first time, I felt needed; I loved Eve, but I never felt she needed me.
I liked movies, though I really didn't care where Clark Gable lived.
